headline: Healthier Mediterranean Tuna Salad
description: Fix yourself a quick and healthier tuna salad made suitable for the Mediterranean diet with red onion, parsley, and a light lemon dressing.
name: Healthier Mediterranean Tuna Salad
recipeIngredient: 2 (5 ounce) cans chunk light tuna in water, drained

recipeInstructions.text: Combine tuna, onion, and parsley in a medium bowl.
Whisk oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Toss with the tuna mixture.

review.reviewBody: Great as is. I did add a little feta and served with humus and celery. My husband actually ate this and liked it!!!!
I also added finely chopped green peppers.

Very, very good. My husband and I were recently told to eat heart healthy. I'm a nut for Mayo based tuna salad. I did not expect to like this so much. It's very tasty and I will not be going back to Mayo. Thanks for the recipe.

Sounds good. The picture seems to include garbanzo beans which should be a healthy addition providing a soft crunch. Pumpkin or sunflower seeds are another addition that would add different textures and flavors
This is so light and refreshing. Never will I use mayo again!

Truly loved it. I added some olive oil but I always do add more oil, butter- whatever. And also a little onion and garlic powder. It really needed nothing. I keep thinking I'm not sure about it- probably tested about a cup so far... can hardly keep my face out of it.... very nice thank you!
Really good tuna salad! Add some drained canellini beans and diced tomatoes and stuff in a pita with some romaine, excellent lunch.
We loved it!
This recipe is scrumptious. It is a super healthy tuna salad. I also recently made it for an afternoon tea party. For the tea, I served this salad in Tostitos Scoops. It was a big hit.
The only thing I changed was I diced up 1 and a half stalks celery other than that followed recipe exactly. Definitely will make again. Hubby loved it.
This is now my go to tuna salad recipe. It is so good! I don’t miss the mayo one bit.

I liked it by my wife really wanted some mayo and pickles. I think I will experiment using a bit of avocado mayo, dill pickles, and perhaps some fresh cucumber or celery. The lemon zest definitely adds a great dimension to the traditional tuna salad.
Try the Cook's Note and double the dressing and pour over greens, tuna, and tomato!
I added raisins which really made a difference

OMG...This was soooo good! Thsis is my first review as I normally dont do them!!I made it exactly as described minus the fresh parsley because I did not have it at home.
You can do SO MUCH with this recipe.....You could add any ingredient you want to change it up to your liking. Examples: Add celery, humus, olives, tomatoes, mushroom beans & much more. You could eat it with salad, wraps, toast, sandwich, lettuce wraps or straight up as I did! You could add or delete ingredients as you like. Examples: add orange zest, grapefruit zest or leave it out. You could add honey, avocado, hot sauce, left over shredded chicken or any meats. You can add or delete anything you want to this recipe! Thank you to who ever posted it!
Used 11oz of tuna versus 10oz but it still came out tasty!
Simple yet delicious! I added diced apple, celery and a little grated carrot.
i absolutely love this recipe I've made it so many times I don't need to follow it anymore, sometimes I add dried mustard or cayanne, always add garlic powder. but seriously so soooo good
Perfect salad
Refreshing and delish over arugula greens

I think I like regular (mayo) tuna salad better, BUT this gets 5 stars for being super easy to make, tasty, healthier, and very inexpensive (all items easily on hand, esp if you are ok with dried parsley as I was). I served it on romaine lettuce leaves and found it very refreshing and a nice change of pace. Thanks for the new recipe in my rotation!
Great Recipe. I added Chopped Celery! Very Healthy & Delicious!
This was great, What a welcome change, from the diced celery and mayo.
used orange zest instead of lemon still came out pretty delicious with some garlic stuffed olives on a sandwich

Delicious & healthy, as are all Mediterranean dishes. Much tastier than tuna w/mayo. The olive oil really elevates the flavors. I used 2 cans of Italian tuna packed in olive oil, so I omitted the additional oil in this recipe. I also added a sprinkle of oregano. Very, very tasty.
Delicious with a diced cherry tomatoes and jalapeño pepper for some added zest paired with Triscuit crackers.

Excellent as written! I lighten it up further by omitting the olive oil or at least use much less and skip the salt. Another option is to add finely chopped celery to the mix. Serve in a scooped out fresh tomato in season or half an avocado for a lovely salad for lunch or dinner. I eat year round and always well received when served to guests. If you love tuna, this is worth a try! If not fond of tuna, sub in diced chicken or turkey.

Yogurt instead of mayo 
I'm allergic to eggs. And mayo is made of eggs in majority.

Completely forgot about this until I saw this recipe, so I made it like I remember from my childhood (very similar).

Mom used to make this when I was younger. The only differences: She added diced, fresh tomatoes and served with pita bread.
This is just like my mom’s recipe, except she adds a can of drained chickpeas for added flavor and texture

I never would have thought of this. I just finished some tuna with mayo. Yours sounds great and I know I'll like it because it has all of my favorite ingredients. I like to use solid white tuna and this will keep it moist but healthy.
I bet this would be good made with chicken too.
